name: Siebel eScript: Avoid Functions with more than X Lines of Code
description:
This rule reports Functions with too many lines of code, above "Siebel: Max LoC".
"Siebel: Max LoC" is a parameter and it can be changed at wrill.
Default value is 50.
output:
This rule reports Functions with too many lines of code. It displays:
- the function full name
- the associated value is the Number of lines of code
rationale: Large functions are more difficult to understand, and are a sign of a bad modularity of the code.
remediation: Review the design of the method to reduce its size
total: Number of added or modified eScripts
alternativeName: Siebel eScript: Avoid Functions with more than X Lines of Code
